skill.name: find-skills
skill.description: Helps users discover and install agent skills when they ask questions like "how do I do X", "find a skill for X", "is there a skill that can...", or express interest in extending capabilities. This skill should be used when the user is looking for functionality that might exist as an installable skill.
skill.summary: Discover and install skills from the open agent skills ecosystem
skill.author: vercel-labs

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected 31 pattern matches that were all determined to be false positives. The 'external_commands' findings were markdown code blocks containing example CLI commands (npx skills), not actual code execution. The 'network' findings were documentation URLs (skills.sh). The 'weak crypto' findings were false matches on text containing 'MD' in words like 'deployment'. The skill contains only documentation with no executable code.

content.value_statement: Users often do not know which skills exist to help with their tasks. This skill guides them to discover relevant capabilities from the open agent ecosystem and install them with simple commands.
actual_capabilities: Search for skills using the npx skills CLI
Recommend relevant skills based on user needs
Provide installation commands for discovered skills
Explain the skills ecosystem and how it works
Suggest alternative search terms when no results are found
Guide users to create custom skills when needed
limitations: Cannot browse the skills registry directly without using the CLI
Skill recommendations are based on keyword matching, not semantic understanding
Installation requires user confirmation or explicit permission flags
Only discovers skills from the public skills ecosystem

use_cases.title: Find Performance Optimization Skills
use_cases.description: A developer asks how to make their React app faster. The skill searches for and recommends the vercel-react-best-practices skill with installation instructions.

use_cases.title: Discover PR Review Tools
use_cases.description: A team lead wants help reviewing pull requests. The skill finds PR review skills and explains how to install them for automated code review assistance.

use_cases.title: Locate Documentation Generators
use_cases.description: A maintainer needs to create a changelog. The skill searches for documentation-related skills and provides options for changelog generation.

prompt_templates.title: Search for a Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Find me a skill for [task description]
prompt_templates.scenario: When the user needs a specific capability

prompt_templates.title: Explore by Category
prompt_templates.prompt: What skills exist for [category like testing, deployment, design]?
prompt_templates.scenario: When the user wants to browse available tools

prompt_templates.title: Get Skill Help
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use the skills CLI to [find/add/update] skills?
prompt_templates.scenario: When the user needs help with skill management

output_examples.input: Find me a skill for React performance
output_examples.output:
I found a skill that might help! The "vercel-react-best-practices" skill provides React and Next.js performance optimization guidelines from Vercel Engineering.

To install it:
npx skills add vercel-labs/agent-skills@vercel-react-best-practices

Learn more: https://skills.sh/vercel-labs/agent-skills/vercel-react-best-practices

output_examples.input: How do I search for skills?
output_examples.output:
You can search for skills using the Skills CLI:

npx skills find [query]

For example:
- npx skills find react performance
- npx skills find pr review
- npx skills find changelog

The command will return matching skills with installation instructions.

output_examples.input: Is there a skill for writing tests?
output_examples.output:
Let me search for testing-related skills for you.

npx skills find testing

Based on common patterns, you might find skills for:
- Jest testing setup and best practices
- Playwright end-to-end testing
- React Testing Library patterns

Would you like me to run the search and show you specific results?

best_practices: Use specific keywords when searching - 'react testing' works better than just 'testing'
Try alternative terms if the first search does not return relevant results
Check skills from verified sources like vercel-labs for quality assurance
anti_patterns: Do not install skills without reviewing what they do first
Avoid vague queries like 'help me' - use specific task descriptions
Do not assume a skill exists for every niche task

faq.question: What is the Skills CLI?
faq.answer: The Skills CLI (npx skills) is the package manager for the open agent skills ecosystem. It allows you to search for, install, and manage skills that extend AI agent capabilities.

faq.question: How do I install a skill?
faq.answer: Use the command 'npx skills add <owner/repo@skill>'. Add the -g flag for global installation and -y to skip confirmation prompts.

faq.question: Where can I browse available skills?
faq.answer: Visit https://skills.sh/ to browse the skills registry, or use 'npx skills find [query]' to search from the command line.

faq.question: What if no skill exists for my task?
faq.answer: If no skill is found, the AI can still help directly using general capabilities. You can also create your own skill with 'npx skills init <name>'.

faq.question: Are skills safe to install?
faq.answer: Skills come from various sources. Review the skill documentation and source repository before installing. Skills from verified organizations like vercel-labs are generally trustworthy.

faq.question: How do I update installed skills?
faq.answer: Run 'npx skills check' to check for updates, and 'npx skills update' to update all installed skills to their latest versions.
